summary.para: Used to request a duplicate of the enumerator object to preserve its current state.

param.name: ppenum
param.para: A pointer to the interface of a new enumerator object.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

remarks.para: The new enumerator should be created with the same state as the current one. Use the method to advance the enumeration index to the appropriate value before returning.

summary.para: Used to request information on one or more search objects.

param.name: celt
param.para: The number of search objects to be enumerated, starting from the current object. If celt is too large, the method should stop and return the actual number of search objects in pceltFetched.

param.name: rgelt
param.para: A pointer to an array of pceltFetched structures containing information on the enumerated objects.

param.name: pceltFetched
param.para: The number of objects actually enumerated. This may be less than celt.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

summary.para: Used to reset the enumeration index to zero.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

summary.para: Skip a specified number of objects.

param.name: celt
param.para: The number of objects to skip.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or a COM-defined error code otherwise.

summary.para: A standard OLE enumerator used by a client to determine the available search objects for a folder.

remarks.para: Implement IEnumExtraSearch if your namespace extension supports one or more search objects.

You do not call this interface directly. An IEnumExtraSearch interface is requested by a client only after it has determined that the interface is exposed. Clients retrieve a pointer to this interface by calling .
IEnumExtraSearch implements and the standard OLE enumeration methods.
